channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Over flowing bins, 14th July
item.description:
These bins stink obstructing the pavement and causing a major rat problem. These bins have been collecting up a line of Wildfell Road residents bins for some time the resident’s bins are been taken and put there by people from the flats it has become a fly tipping hot spot we now have rats running round our gardens and outside our front door in day light not even the dark. I believe these bins should not be there in the first place as they were not before. I am disabled and having to go onto the road as have other residents could this matter please be addressed once and for all it’s been going on for years now I take pride in where I live but it’s starting to look like a dump here

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Wildfell Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping black bag and abandoned bin, 14th July
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 14th July
item.description:
Fly tipping by Canal Walk on Meadowcourt Road is a continual problem. There is currently 2 matresses, 1 fridges and multiple bags of rubbish which are taking over the pavement and make the road look very undesirable. Appreciate if this could be removed as soon as possible. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowcourt Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bin outside 25 Manchester Square is full of litter, 14th July
item.description:
The public bin located outside the 25 Manchester square near the junction of Manchester Square and hinde street is full of litter. The bin needs to empty.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11-14, Hinde Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Self sowing trees, 14th July
item.description:
The verge in Tent Peg Lane BR5 abutting my property 34 crest view drive, has a line of self sowing trees which if left to become established will create a "wall" and potential tree root problems. The one nearest crest view is already tall and although lower branches pruned earlier in year, it does obstruct view for cars coming out of tent peg lane. Happy to discuss contribution to complete removal, planting of alternative or even tarmac-ing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tent Peg Lane, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
